Author: throwaway658_
Text: thanks, man. <3  even if it’s cliche, i can feel your sincerity. i’m in my early 20s now, trying to claw my way back to normalcy (well, more like trying to stumble upon it by following the map of “consistent piano practice”, “a skincare routine!” and “going to work every day even though all ur clothes bring u immense sensory discomfort”).   and it’s hard being that person that “fell off the wagon”. it brings a lot of shame.  but i think that the people that manage to keep on despite being truly alone must be some of the toughest people in the world. because humans are social creatures, and we are persisting despite the fact that doing so goes against every basic biological impulse we have.  so i wish you the best. and i hope you find the peace and connection that you’re looking for.

Author: Sea_Plane
Text: This is so relatable, I could've written this myself. I struggle so badly with isolation and agoraphobia too, I've lost all my friends. It's really rough and lonely, stuck in the house with my obsessions. I don't have anything useful to say other than 'I relate' and 'me too'. Please don't beat yourself up over this - recovery is incredibly difficult, and you deserve kindness. I want to give you a hug. It's okay to mess up sometimes. It doesn't cancel out the incredible progress you've made. This binge is nothing compared to what you've achieved. Recovery isn't just maintenance, it's getting back up after you've been knocked down.
